      private java.lang.String m_OutputFile
      The file, storing the nearest neighbours data:
      START_TARGET1;index
      START_TUPLE1;index
      NB_TARGET_VALUES1;numberOfTargetValues
      NN(2;0.21;0.21)&...&NN(32;0.121;0.51)
      ...

      ...

    • Field Detail

      • m_OutputFile

        private java.lang.String m_OutputFile
        The file, storing the nearest neighbours data:
        START_TARGET1;index
        START_TUPLE1;index
        NB_TARGET_VALUES1;numberOfTargetValues
        NN(2;0.21;0.21)&...&NN(32;0.121;0.51)
        ...
        NN(4;0.31;0.11)&...&NN(112;0.1;0.1)
        END_TUPLE1
        START_TUPLE2;index
        ...
        END_TUPLE2
        ...
        END_TUPLEn
        END_TARGET1
        START_TARGET2;index
        ...
        where NN-lines are produced by the NearestNeighbour.toFileString() method. Each line corresponds to one target value.

      • m_InputFiles

        private java.lang.String[] m_InputFiles
        The file names that store the NN-s, which are given in the same way as in the m_OutputFile. They are joined into one structure when loading.

      • assureIsFlatNearestNeighbours

        public static void assureIsFlatNearestNeighbours(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,NearestNeighbour[][]>> nnss)
        Used outside of Relief, when we only need the nearest neighbours of each instance and targets do not have any influence. Thus, we check whether the structure

        {targetIndex: {tupleIndex: [neighbours for the first target value, neighbours for target second value, ...], ...}, ...}

        can be flattened to {tupleIndex: neigbours for the first target value, ...}.

        Makes sure that only one target index is present and that it equals {DUMMY_TARGET. Also, makes sure that each tuple has only the neighbours for one target value.
        If any of these conditions are broken, an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        nnss - Nearest neighbours in the Relief form.
